Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't.
A single strand of spaghetti is called a 'spaghetto'.
Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood.
The moon has moonquakes.
There’s a basketball court on the top floor of the U.S. Supreme Court building. It’s nicknamed 'the highest court in the land'.
Honey never spoils – archaeologists have found edible honey in ancient Egyptian tombs.
Sloths can hold their breath longer than dolphins.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped.
Sharks existed before trees did.
There's a species of jellyfish that is biologically immortal.
The Eiffel Tower can grow over 6 inches in summer due to heat expansion.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
Scotland’s national animal is the unicorn.
The inventor of the frisbee was turned into a frisbee after he died.
You can’t hum while holding your nose closed.
The dot over a lowercase 'i' is called a 'tittle'.
Some turtles can breathe through their butts.
A cloud can weigh over a million pounds.
The average person will spend about six months of their life waiting for red lights to turn green.
Cows have best friends and get stressed when separated.
Butterflies can taste with their feet.
There's a town in Norway where the sun doesn’t rise for months.
A day on Venus is longer than its year.
Humans share about 60% of their DNA with bananas.
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on Earth.
Tigers have striped skin, not just striped fur.
A bolt of lightning is five times hotter than the surface of the sun.
An octopus can taste with its arms.
The first alarm clock could only ring at 4 a.m.
In Japan, letting a sumo wrestler make your baby cry is considered good luck.
Water can boil and freeze at the same time (triple point).
The longest hiccuping spree lasted 68 years.
A crocodile cannot stick its tongue out.
The heart of a blue whale is the size of a small car.
Pineapples take about two years to grow.
The human nose can detect over 1 trillion different smells.
Cats can't taste sweetness.
There’s enough DNA in your body to stretch from the sun to Pluto and back — 17 times.
A snail can sleep for three years.
Rats laugh when tickled.
The current U.S. flag was designed by a 17-year-old for a school project. He got a B-.
Hot water freezes faster than cold water (the Mpemba effect).
Sea otters hold hands while sleeping to keep from drifting apart.
The majority of your brain is fat.
Alaska is the westernmost, easternmost, and northernmost state in the U.S.
An ant can survive in a microwave.
Vending machines are more deadly than sharks.
Humans glow in the dark — just not enough for our eyes to see it.
A jiffy is an actual unit of time: 1/100th of a second.
Your stomach gets a new lining every 3–4 days to prevent it from digesting itself.
Ketchup was once sold as medicine.
The 'M's in M&M stand for Mars and Murrie.
A human sneeze can travel up to 100 miles per hour.
Earth is the only planet not named after a god.
Antarctica is the driest, windiest, and coldest continent.
Giraffes only need 5 to 30 minutes of sleep per day.
A bolt of lightning contains enough energy to toast 100,000 slices of bread.
Owls don't have eyeballs — their eyes are tube-shaped.
Bubble wrap was originally intended to be wallpaper.
The average cloud contains about half a million kilograms of water.
The smell of freshly-cut grass is actually a plant distress call.
Jellyfish don’t have brains, hearts, or bones.
Some fungi create zombies — they infect ants and control their behavior.
The Spanish national anthem has no official words.
A shrimp’s heart is located in its head.
Saturn could float in water because it’s mostly gas.
The tongue is the only muscle in the body attached at only one end.
There's a planet made of diamonds (55 Cancri e).
